application

Class Staff

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Staff

  • public class Staff
extends java.lang.Object
    The Staff class instantiates Staff objects that can be displayed in TableViews after retrieving the relevant records and data from a database The methods and structure of this class are derived from the tutorials available from the ProgrammingKnowledge playlist JavaFX tutorial for beginners : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9YrmON6nlEw&list=PLS1QulWo1RIaUGP446_pWLgTZPiFizEMq
    Author:
    jarrod joshua

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty isManager 
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty password 
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleIntegerProperty staffID 
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty username 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Staff(int staffID, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String isManager)
      The class constructor takes int and String type inputs and outputs a Staff object with JavaFX properties that can be displayed in a TableView.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getIsManager()
      Return a String "true" or "false" only describing if the Staff object allows manager access to the program
      java.lang.String getPassword()
      Return the password attribute of the Staff object as a String
      int getStaffID()
      Returns the staffID property of the Staff object as an int
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      Return the username attribute of the Staff object as a String

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Staff

        public Staff(int staffID,
             java.lang.String username,
             java.lang.String password,
             java.lang.String isManager)
        The class constructor takes int and String type inputs and outputs a Staff object with JavaFX properties that can be displayed in a TableView. The getters output int or Strings not properties
        Parameters:
        staffID - : an int specifying the staffID attribute of this Staff Object
        username - : a String specifying the 'username' field of the Staff Object
        password - : A String specifying the 'password' field of the Staff Object
        isManager - : A String "true" or "false" specifying if the Staff Object allows for manager level access to the program

    • Method Detail

      • getStaffID

        public int getStaffID()
        Returns the staffID property of the Staff object as an int
        Returns:
        staffID : int specifying the staffID property of the Staff Object

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Return the username attribute of the Staff object as a String
        Returns:
        username : a String specifying the 'username' field of the Staff object

      • getPassword

        public java.lang.String getPassword()
        Return the password attribute of the Staff object as a String
        Returns:
        password : a String specifying the 'password' field of the Staff object

      • getIsManager

        public java.lang.String getIsManager()
        Return a String "true" or "false" only describing if the Staff object allows manager access to the program
        Returns:
        isManager : A String "true" if the corresponding staff account for this Staff object allows login to the manager screen, or "false" if not
